TopicTitle: How to dock if im on opposite sides of my target

Articles.Content: I trying to dock with a satellite I made, but I've ended up on the complete opposite side of the satellite. What is the easiest way to get closer to the satellite without using too much fuel?

You'll want to be on either high or lower orbital altitude to have a different orbital period so it can catch up to you or your catch up to it. After a couple of orbits it will be close enough that you can make a maneuver node to intercept its orbit with a close separation distance.

So you’re in the same/similar orbit as your target but on the wrong side of the planet? A phasing orbit is your best bet: set up a burn so that your apoapsis is higher and your orbital period longer than the target but with the orbits still crossing at some point, then add a second node after the first and move it forwards a few orbits until you find a close-ish approach. Tiny tweaks to the first node will shift the encounter so that you arrive at your target after a few orbits without using much fuel.

The greater the difference between your orbits, the greater the fuel use; conversely a very similar orbit will take a lot longer for one craft to catch up to the other.
